moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+
comment: White's variation after 13...Nc5 14.f6 gxf6 15.gxf6 Bf8 16.Rg1! is a tough nut to crack.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8
comment: 15...Qe7 is the more popular alternative, however by playing rare line in a sub-variation I may surprise my opponent. Afterwards Rizzitano told me that he had several games with this position I didn't even know!

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6
comment: After 16.Rg1 I played the novelty 16...h6! in the game Wolff-Browne, World Open 1989, which I managed to win in a very exciting ending.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6
comment: The most critical line. After 17...0-0 Black concedes a slight edge to White.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7
comment: I have to move my king off the f-line sooner or later.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7
comment: A very important move which underlines my strategy to control the f-line. On c8, the rook would be subject to attack via h3, not to mention the fact that Black can't hope for any real pressure on c2.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7 21. Bh3 Rf8 22. Rhf1 Raf7 23. Rxf7+ Rxf7
comment: White correctly neutralizes my pressure on the file, but he can't claim any advantage and we both had over 4 minutes left!

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7 21. Bh3 Rf8 22. Rhf1 Raf7 23. Rxf7+ Rxf7 24. Be6 Rf3 25. Bg4 Rf8
comment: The bishop is worse on g4 than on e6.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7 21. Bh3 Rf8 22. Rhf1 Raf7 23. Rxf7+ Rxf7 24. Be6 Rf3 25. Bg4 Rf8 26. Bh3 Bh4
comment: A wonderful all-purpose move! Firstly, I want to play Rf8-f2, but this is almost a misdirection as the Black queen will enter the game powerfully on g5.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7 21. Bh3 Rf8 22. Rhf1 Raf7 23. Rxf7+ Rxf7 24. Be6 Rf3 25. Bg4 Rf8 26. Bh3 Bh4 27. Rf1 Rxf1+ 28. Qxf1 Qg5
comment: The idea of Qg5-d2xh2 can't be adequately repulsed as 29.Qe2 allows 29...Qg1+ and 29.Qd1 runs into 29...Nc4.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7 21. Bh3 Rf8 22. Rhf1 Raf7 23. Rxf7+ Rxf7 24. Be6 Rf3 25. Bg4 Rf8 26. Bh3 Bh4 27. Rf1 Rxf1+ 28. Qxf1 Qg5 29. a4

1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7 21. Bh3 Rf8 22. Rhf1 Raf7 23. Rxf7+ Rxf7 24. Be6 Rf3 25. Bg4 Rf8 26. Bh3 Bh4 27. Rf1 Rxf1+ 28. Qxf1 Qg5 29. a4 Nc4
comment: Threat on threat it seems. however once again the other idea or Qg5-e5 is a killer.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7 21. Bh3 Rf8 22. Rhf1 Raf7 23. Rxf7+ Rxf7 24. Be6 Rf3 25. Bg4 Rf8 26. Bh3 Bh4 27. Rf1 Rxf1+ 28. Qxf1 Qg5 29. a4 Nc4 30. Qd3 Qe5 31. Nc3 Bf6
comment: Everything just fits! Now Black is better.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7 21. Bh3 Rf8 22. Rhf1 Raf7 23. Rxf7+ Rxf7 24. Be6 Rf3 25. Bg4 Rf8 26. Bh3 Bh4 27. Rf1 Rxf1+ 28. Qxf1 Qg5 29. a4 Nc4 30. Qd3 Qe5 31. Nc3 Bf6 32. axb5 axb5 33. Qd5 Qxh2 34. Bd7
comment: White begins to go astray. Note that after 34.Be6 Bxc3! 35.bxc3 Qe5, Black consolidates for an easy win.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7 21. Bh3 Rf8 22. Rhf1 Raf7 23. Rxf7+ Rxf7 24. Be6 Rf3 25. Bg4 Rf8 26. Bh3 Bh4 27. Rf1 Rxf1+ 28. Qxf1 Qg5 29. a4 Nc4 30. Qd3 Qe5 31. Nc3 Bf6 32. axb5 axb5 33. Qd5 Qxh2 34. Bd7 Qg1+ 35. Ka2
comment: After playing fairly well my opponent cracks, but 35.Qd1 Qc5 36.Nxb5 Qb4 37.b3 Ne5 38.Nxd6 Nxd7 39.Ne8+ Kf8 40.Qxd7 Qe1+ 41.Ka2 Qa1 mate is one of the many wins that Black has.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5 11. Bxf6 Nxf6 12. g5 Nd7 13. f5 Bxg5+ 14. Kb1 Ne5 15. Qh5 Qd8 16. Nxe6 Bxe6 17. fxe6 g6 18. exf7+ Kxf7 19. Qe2 Kg7 20. Nd5 Ra7 21. Bh3 Rf8 22. Rhf1 Raf7 23. Rxf7+ Rxf7 24. Be6 Rf3 25. Bg4 Rf8 26. Bh3 Bh4 27. Rf1 Rxf1+ 28. Qxf1 Qg5 29. a4 Nc4 30. Qd3 Qe5 31. Nc3 Bf6 32. axb5 axb5 33. Qd5 Qxh2 34. Bd7 Qg1+ 35. Ka2 Qa7+ 36. Kb1 Qxd7 37. Nxb5 Nxb2 38. Nxd6 Qe7
comment: I still had over 2 minutes left and wasn't going to fall for any cheapos!

Nc3 Bf6 32. axb5 axb5 33. Qd5 Qxh2 34. Bd7 Qg1+ 35. Ka2 Qa7+ 36. Kb1 Qxd7 37. Nxb5 Nxb2 38. Nxd6 Qe7 39. Nb5 Na4 40. Kc1 Nc3 41. Nxc3 Qa3+ 42. Kd1 Qxc3 43. Qd7+ Kh6 44. Qe6 Bg5 45. Qd5 Qf3+ 46. Ke1 Be3 47. c4 Bb6 48. c5 Ba5+
comment: I would've felt good enough if this was a serious tournament game, but for Blitz this must be considered one of my best efforts.
